questions.content: You need to decide on a suitable location for a flood shelter. This is going to be quickly built in the flood alert area as a place where people can evacuate to. Look at the map below and decide which of the four locations would be most suitable:
You now need to make a call – who should you share this flood alert warning with? Choose up to three.
You need to decide what messages you want to share with the local people. Which of these measuresthings are suitable for the population to do in this flood alert area? Choose up to four.

answers.content: Evacuate to the nearest town or city - maybe where you have relatives
Know where you are going and how you will get there
Ensure that you have adequate insurance
Ensure that you have an emergency flood kit
Call the police to let them know about the flood event

questions.content: You need to advise people on what to put into an emergency flood kit. What would you tell people in this community to include. Include up to six

answers.content: A list of family and friend phone numbers for people who don't live in the area

questions.content: You need to provide resources which will be available for the whole local community. Which of the following are most suitable for this community? Choose up to three.

answers.content: Empty water containers for people to fill before the water supply goes off
Ensure that the local school is set up as a place for people to evacuate to
Set up a telephone hotline for people to call if they are unsure what to do

questions.content: You then hold a meeting with your Red Cross Team who will disseminate this information to the local people. What is the best way for them to do this? Choose up to three

answers.content: To knock on all doors in the local area and tell people to evacuate
To hold an education meeting where you share the information
To deliver leaflets through all the doors
To contact the local radio station to broadcast the information
To put up posters in the local area
To tweet the message or use some other form of social media

questions.content: People are asking you about saving their possessions and belongings. What would you advise? Choose up to three

answers.content: For people to take their livestock to higher ground
For people to move their photographs and electrical goods upstairs
For people to take their weapons with them for protection
For people to take their pets upstairs
To take as many things as they can with them when they evacuate

questions.content: You want to ensure that there is no one in serious danger – how do you go about doing this? Choose one

answers.content: Get into a small boat and row around the community to see if anyone needs to be rescued and taken to higher ground
Get the emergency services to take you around in a small power boat to look in individual houses for people who are stranded
Tweet for people to contact you if they are in danger
Check with people in rescue shelters if they know anyone stranded in the floods

questions.content: 9.	You are having a meeting with the Government official in charge of flooding. What advice would you give them to help them prepare for future flood events. Choose up to three

answers.content: To ensure that children in all schools have education on what to do in a flood
To ensure that the emergency services have a clear plan of action
To rebuild all houses on stilts (raised up off the ground)
To broadcast flood education through social media
To organise community education events e.g. puppet shows to teach local people about flooding
To build levees (build up the banks of the river
To rebuild the settlement further upstream

questions.content: In your meeting, the government official asks you if there is any additional data that would help their country to predict and prepare for a flood event. What would you advise? Choose up to three

answers.content: Probabilistic weather forecasts and decision making mechanisms
Land use mapping  with ongoing monitoring

sections.name: The Scenario
sections.content:
There is torrential rain in Peru’s southern Andean Cusco region where 16,000 people live. The area has seen constant rainfall for the last 15 days, but it has been particularly heavy for the last few days. The Quillabamba River is dangerously high and has the potential to burst its banks.


 This region is remote, and has many steep sided slopes. Access is limited. The level of development is low. There is little electricity if any.

sections.content: Before you leave for the flood alert area you have a few things to do:

sections.name: Section B
sections.content: You have now arrived in the flood alert location and need to start on your goal of preserving the lives of the people who are now vulnerable to this flood event. Before you get into the community you have some more decisions to make about how you can best help these people:

sections.name: Section C
sections.content: You are now on the streets and there is panic. The flood waters are rising.

sections.name: Section D
sections.content: The flood event has now passed.
